docs.snippet: THE final concert of the season of the International Music Festival at Caramoor in Katonah takes place at 5:30 P.M. today, featuring young participants in the festival's ''Rising Stars'' project who have been receiving coaching, taking master classes...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE final concert of the season of the International Music Festival at Caramoor in Katonah takes place at 5:30 P.M. today, featuring young participants in the festival's ''Rising Stars'' project who have been receiving coaching, taking master classes and joining in rehearsals with renowned artists. Today's recital brings back the pianist Stella Simakova and the violinist Elisa Barston, recent alumni of the program, and introduces Timothy Fain and Phillip Quint, also violinists, the violists Nicholas Cords and I-Chen Wang and the cellists Edward Arron and Alexis Gerlach. On the program are Beethoven's String Quintet in C, the A minor Quartet of Anton Arensky and Dvorak's Piano Quintet in A. The box office number is 232-1252.
docs.abstract: Final concert of season at International Music Festival at Caramoor in Katonah, NY, will feature particpants in Rising Stars project;music of Haydn will be featured at Bard Music Festival in Annandale-on-Hudson; August Fest at Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center in Nyack, NY, continues with program of Russian dance; troup headed by Robert Robinson is preparing for concert to benefit Chappaqua Volunteer Ambulance Corps; photo (M)

docs.snippet: Long before the first copies of Tiempos del Mundo ever hit the newsstand last year, the flashy, Spanish-language newspaper that is linked to the Rev. Sun Myung Moon's Unification Church was making headlines of its own.    At the newspaper's gala...
docs.lead_paragraph: Long before the first copies of Tiempos del Mundo ever hit the newsstand last year, the flashy, Spanish-language newspaper that is linked to the Rev. Sun Myung Moon's Unification Church was making headlines of its own. At the newspaper's gala inauguration, former President George Bush called Mr. Moon a ''visionary'' for creating Tiempos del Mundo, or Times of the World, an 80-page tabloid that its backers said would be distributed by satellite to almost every country in North and South America.
docs.abstract: Tiempos del Mundo, Spanish-language newspaper linked to Rev Sun Myung Moon's Unification Church, is making headlines of its own; backers say 80-page tabloid would be distributed by satellite to almost every country in North and South America; critics denounce paper as just another vehicle for Unification Church to proselytize Latin America, where Korean-based sect has invested hundreds of millions of dollars in variety of businesses; photo (M)

headline.main: A Newspaper for Half a Hemisphere?

docs.snippet: TENNIS    Chang Topples Medvedev     Michael Chang, the world's second-ranked player, celebrated his selection to the United States Davis Cup team by beating Andrei Medvedev of Ukraine, 7-6 (8-6), 6-4, in the first round of the Hamlet Cup last night...
docs.lead_paragraph: TENNIS Chang Topples Medvedev Michael Chang, the world's second-ranked player, celebrated his selection to the United States Davis Cup team by beating Andrei Medvedev of Ukraine, 7-6 (8-6), 6-4, in the first round of the Hamlet Cup last night in Commack, N.Y. The victory improved Chang's record to 49-12 this year, best on the ATP Tour. It was the top-seeded Chang's sixth victory in seven matches over four years against Medvedev, who is the defending champion here.

docs.snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-14    Space Agency Struggles With New Mir Trouble  After six months of near-disasters on Russia's Mir space station, officials of the Russian Space Agency are acknowledging the sorry state of the craft's onboard systems.   A1   ...
docs.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-14 Space Agency Struggles With New Mir Trouble After six months of near-disasters on Russia's Mir space station, officials of the Russian Space Agency are acknowledging the sorry state of the craft's onboard systems. A1 Rockets Land in Northern Israel Islamic guerrillas fired dozens of rockets into northern Israel to avenge a deadly attack Monday by militiamen aligned with Israel. The attack caused only minor damage and injuries, but the barrages were by far the heaviest since clashes between Hezbollah guerrillas and Israeli forces in southern Lebanon erupted into full-scale battle in April 1996. Israel said it was not preparing immediate retaliation. A14

docs.snippet: One morning recently, air-traffic controllers here advised the crew of an Avianca Airlines flight arriving from Bogota, Colombia, that the airport was closed because of low clouds and that the plane should proceed to an airport 400 miles to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: One morning recently, air-traffic controllers here advised the crew of an Avianca Airlines flight arriving from Bogota, Colombia, that the airport was closed because of low clouds and that the plane should proceed to an airport 400 miles to the northwest, where the skies were clear. But as the Avianca plane, running low on fuel, approached that airport in Cordoba Province an hour later, controllers told the pilots that it was too cloudy to land there. They were told to fly 200 miles farther northwest to an airport in La Rioja Province, where the plane finally touched down with only 14 minutes of fuel left.
docs.abstract: Safety of Argentina's airports and antiquated air-traffic control systems have caused growing consternation after series of erroneous re-routings and near collisions in recent months; pilots' union has warned that air travel in country is unsafe, and air force has dismissed several top officials and staff members responsible for air traffic control; Government austerity plan has reduced funds for all military services, including air force budget for airports (M)

headline.main: Blunders Fan Fears Over Air Safety in Argentina

docs.snippet: World Cup Qualifying     Despite an unimpressive 1-1 tie with Portugal over the weekend, Germany appears set to keep its record intact as the only country to have qualified for every World Cup. The European champion needs 5 points in its two...
docs.lead_paragraph: World Cup Qualifying Despite an unimpressive 1-1 tie with Portugal over the weekend, Germany appears set to keep its record intact as the only country to have qualified for every World Cup. The European champion needs 5 points in its two remaining home matches, against Armenia and Albania, to lock up a berth in the finals next summer in France. In other games over the weekend, Greece defeated Slovenia, and Croatia topped Bosnia-Herzegovina; the Netherlands qualified with a 3-1 victory over Belgium, and Austria beat Sweden in the most important games in Europe.

docs.snippet: SOCCER    Four Countries Qualify    Argentina, Bulgaria, Colombia and Paraguay qualified for the 1998 World Cup last night, and England moved past Italy to set up a key game in Rome next month to determine the winner in their group.

docs.abstract: Argentina, Bulgaria, Colombia and Paraguay qualify for 1998 World Cup soccer tournament (S)

docs.snippet: After years of backstage rivalry between Brazil and the United States over which country's vision will shape the rules of trade in this part of the hemisphere, a high-level economic conference here has emerged as a coming-out party for Mercosur, a...
docs.lead_paragraph: After years of backstage rivalry between Brazil and the United States over which country's vision will shape the rules of trade in this part of the hemisphere, a high-level economic conference here has emerged as a coming-out party for Mercosur, a Brazilian-led South American trade group. Leaders who spoke before the World Economic Forum, a business-financed research group that met last week in Sao Paulo, acknowledged the advances Mercosur had made in promoting regional trade. They also noted that the United States had done little to advance President Clinton's 1994 pledge at the Summit of the Americas in Miami to create a ''Free Trade Area of the Americas from Alaska to Tierra del Fuego'' by 2005.
docs.abstract: Leaders gathered in Rio de Janeiro for conference sponsored by World Economic Forum, business-financed research group, cite advances Brazilian-led South American trade group Mercosur has made in promoting regional trade; note United States has done little to advance Pres Clinton's 1994 pledge to create free trade zone that includes Latin America by 2005 (M)

headline.main: With or Without U.S., Latin Trade Group Is Marching Forward
